Tasks.Task Description: Identify the goals and objectives for implementing Microsoft Purview for analytics. Determine the data sources, types of analytics, and compliance requirements.
Evaluate the organization's data governance needs, including data classification, lineage, and access control policies.
Set up a Microsoft Purview account in the Azure portal. Ensure the account is linked to the appropriate subscription and resource group.
Connect Microsoft Purview to the required data sources, such as Azure Data Lake, SQL databases, or on-premises data stores.
Configure scanning rules and schedules to automatically discover and classify data within connected data sources.
Apply security controls such as role-based access control (RBAC), encryption, and data masking to ensure data protection.
Create and apply data classification policies to categorize data based on sensitivity and compliance requirements.
Configure data lineage tracking to visualize how data flows across systems and transformations.
Configure monitoring and alerting for data governance activities using Azure Monitor and Microsoft Purview's built-in tools.
Perform testing to ensure data scanning, classification, and lineage tracking are functioning as expected. Validate compliance with organizational policies.
Create detailed documentation of the Microsoft Purview setup, including configurations, policies, and operational procedures.
Conduct training sessions for users and administrators on how to use Microsoft Purview for analytics and data governance.
Set up regular auditing procedures to ensure compliance with data governance policies and regulatory requirements.
Review and optimize the Microsoft Purview setup for performance and scalability based on data volume and analytics requirements.
